title: Tabernacle Set Up
shortSummary: Exodus 40 details the final instructions and execution of setting up the Tabernacle, God's dwelling place among Israel. It highlights the anointing of the Tabernacle, the priests, and the visible manifestation of God's glory, signifying His presence and guidance for His people.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus and Wilderness Tabernacle Construction

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: God's appointed leader who faithfully follows divine instructions to set up the Tabernacle and anoint the priests.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: The first high priest, anointed and consecrated along with his sons to minister before the LORD.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron's Sons
keyCharacters.description: Priests anointed to serve alongside Aaron in the priestly office, establishing the everlasting priesthood.

definitions.definition: The portable sanctuary where God dwelt among the Israelites during their wilderness journey.
The act of consecrating or setting apart by pouring oil, symbolizing holiness and divine approval.
A basin for washing, used by priests to cleanse themselves before ministering, symbolizing purification.
The sacred chest containing the tablets of the covenant, representing God's presence and covenant with Israel.
A visible manifestation of God's glory and presence, guiding and protecting Israel.

outline.heading: Instructions for Setting Up the Tabernacle
outline.description: God commands Moses to set up the Tabernacle on the first day of the first month, detailing the placement of sacred objects and the anointing of the Tabernacle and priests, emphasizing holiness and divine appointment.

outline.heading: Moses Obeys and Sets Up the Tabernacle
outline.description: Moses follows all the LORD’s commands precisely, assembling the Tabernacle, arranging the furnishings, and performing the consecrations, demonstrating faithful obedience to God’s instructions.

outline.heading: God’s Glory Fills the Tabernacle
outline.description: The LORD’s presence visibly fills the Tabernacle in a cloud, signifying God's acceptance and dwelling among His people, and guiding Israel’s journey by the cloud and fire.

application: Obey God’s commands carefully and faithfully, trusting His instructions even when the tasks seem detailed or difficult.
Recognize the importance of holiness and consecration in serving God, following the example of the anointing of the priests and Tabernacle.
Trust in God’s presence and guidance in your life, as He leads and protects His people visibly and faithfully.
Commit to spiritual cleansing and preparation before approaching God, just as the priests washed at the laver.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the vessels thereof: and it shall be holy.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the sanctification of God's dwelling place, showing the necessity of holiness in approaching Him.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and anoint him, and sanctify him; that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the consecration of the priesthood, setting apart those who serve God in sacred ministry.

keyVerses.text: Then a cloud covered the tent of the congregation, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the tangible presence of God, affirming His acceptance of the Tabernacle and His people.

keyVerses.text: For the cloud of the LORD was upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
keyVerses.significance: It shows God’s continual guidance and protection over Israel, a powerful reminder of His faithfulness.
